table.name: p_language
table.descr: List of language codes
table.label: Language

tablefield.name: p_language_code_c
tablefield.descr: This is the code used to identify a language.
tablefield.label: Language Code
tablefield.help: Enter an internationally accepted language code

tablefield.name: p_language_description_c
tablefield.label: Description
tablefield.help: Enter a full description or name

tablefield.name: p_congress_language_l
tablefield.descr: This field indicates whether or not the language is one that is 'officially' used at conferences. These are the languages for which translation could be provided.
tablefield.label: Congress Language
tablefield.help: Indicates if the language is an 'official' Congress Language.

tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.descr: This defines if the language code can be deleted.
tablefield.label: Deletable
tablefield.help: This code is Required for System operation by other code

table.name: a_frequency
table.descr: Units of time. Used in partner letters. Also used to indicate how often a publication is produced or a receipt is sent to a donor.
table.label: Frequency

table.name: p_international_postal_type
table.descr: Post office mailing zone classification
table.label: International Postal Type

tablefield.name: p_internat_postal_type_code_c
tablefield.label: International Postal Type Code
tablefield.help: Enter an international postal type code

tablefield.name: p_description_c
tablefield.label: Description
tablefield.help: Enter a description

tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.descr:
This defines if the international postal type code can be deleted.
This can only be updated by the system manager.
At the risk of serious operational integrity.
Default to Yes
tablefield.label: Deletable
tablefield.help: This code is Required for System operation by other code

table.name: p_country
table.descr: List of countries with their codes
table.label: Country

tablefield.name: p_country_code_c
tablefield.descr:
This is a code which identifies a country.
It is the ISO code (ISO 3166)
tablefield.label: Country Code
tablefield.help: Enter an internationally accepted (ISO) country code

tablefield.name: p_country_name_c
tablefield.descr: The name of the country
tablefield.label: Country Name
tablefield.help: Enter the full name of the country

tablefield.name: p_undercover_l
tablefield.descr: Describes if the country is politically sensitive.
tablefield.label: Undercover
tablefield.help: Select if the country is politically sensitive

tablefield.name: p_internat_telephone_code_i
tablefield.descr: The telephone code needed to dial into a country
tablefield.label: International Dialing Code
tablefield.help: Enter the International Code needed to dial INTO the country

tablefield.name: p_internat_postal_type_code_c
tablefield.label: International Postal Type Code
tablefield.help: Enter an international postal type code

tablefield.name: p_internat_access_code_c
tablefield.descr: The code needed to dial out of a country.
tablefield.label: International Access Dialing Code
tablefield.help: International telephone access code needed to dial OUT

tablefield.name: p_time_zone_minimum_n
tablefield.descr: Number of hours +/- GMT
tablefield.label: Time Zone Range Minimum
tablefield.help: Enter the minimum time zone +/- relative to GMT

tablefield.name: p_time_zone_maximum_n
tablefield.descr: Number of hours +/- GMT
tablefield.label: Time Zone Range Maximum
tablefield.help: Enter the maximum time zone +/- relative to GMT

tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.descr:
This defines if the country code can be deleted.
This can only be updated by the system manager.
At the risk of serious operational integrity.
Default to Yes
tablefield.label: Deletable
tablefield.help: This code is Required for System operation by other code

tablefield.name: p_address_order_i
tablefield.descr: Tab order of the city, county, and post code fields on the Partner Edit screen
tablefield.label: Address Display Order
tablefield.help: 0 = International; 1 = European; 2 = American

tablefield.name: p_country_name_local_c
tablefield.descr: The name of the country in the Local language
tablefield.label: Country Name In Local Language
tablefield.help: Enter the full name of the country in your local language

table.name: a_currency
table.descr: Unit of money for various countries.
table.label: Currency

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: This defines which currency is being used
tablefield.label: Currency Code
tablefield.help: Enter a currency code

tablefield.name: a_currency_name_c
tablefield.descr: This is the name of the currency
tablefield.label: Currency Name
tablefield.help: Enter the currency name

tablefield.name: a_currency_symbol_c
tablefield.descr: This is the symbol used to show a currency. Eg $US or £
tablefield.label: Currency Symbol
tablefield.help: Enter the symbol which represents this currency

tablefield.name: p_country_code_c
tablefield.descr: Country code
tablefield.label: Country Code
tablefield.help: Enter a valid country code.

tablefield.name: a_display_format_c
tablefield.descr: The format in which to display and accept input on a currency (decimal values)
tablefield.label: Display Format
tablefield.help: The format in which to display and accept input on a currency.

tablefield.name: a_in_emu_l
tablefield.descr: Indicates whether currency is part of the european exchange rate mechanism/ European Monetary Union
tablefield.label: In EMU
tablefield.help: Is this currency one of EMU currencies?

table.name: s_user
table.descr: List of users
table.label: User

tablefield.name: s_user_id_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies who the current user is
tablefield.label: User ID
tablefield.help: Enter the User ID

tablefield.name: s_email_address_c
tablefield.label: Email Address
tablefield.help: Enter the Email Address of this user

tablefield.name: s_first_name_c
tablefield.label: Personal Name
tablefield.help: Enter the Personal Name of this user

tablefield.name: s_last_name_c
tablefield.label: Family Name
tablefield.help: Enter the Family Name of this user

tablefield.name: s_password_hash_c
tablefield.descr: Hash value of the user's Salted password

tablefield.name: s_password_salt_c
tablefield.descr: The Salt value used for hashing the password (two identical passwords will not yield the same Hash value with different Salt values)

tablefield.name: s_pwd_scheme_version_i
tablefield.descr: Version Number of the password hashing scheme (source code gives details about what algorithm/parameters combination is used for each number).
tablefield.label: Password Hashing Scheme Version

tablefield.name: s_password_needs_change_l
tablefield.descr: Forces change of password at next login. Set when the SYSADMIN changes a password for a user. Also, data migration from legacy system will set this. Further to this it can *optionally* be set if a new password hashing scheme got introduced and the user should be forced to change to it by means of an enforced password change.
tablefield.label: Password needs change
tablefield.help: Forces change of password at next login

tablefield.name: s_account_locked_l
tablefield.label: Locked?
tablefield.help: Account Locked?

tablefield.name: s_retired_l
tablefield.label: Retired
tablefield.help: User Retired?

tablefield.name: s_last_login_date_d
tablefield.descr: The date the user last logged in.
tablefield.label: Last Login Date

tablefield.name: s_language_code_c
tablefield.descr: This is the code used to identify a language.
tablefield.label: Language Code
tablefield.help: Enter the language code

tablefield.name: s_can_modify_l
tablefield.descr: This defines if the code can be modified
tablefield.label: Can Modify
tablefield.help: Enter Yes or No

tablefield.name: s_record_delete_l
tablefield.label: Delete System Records
tablefield.help: Delete system records?

tablefield.name: s_acquisition_code_c
tablefield.descr: This code identifies the method of aquisition.
tablefield.label: Acquisition Code
tablefield.help: Enter the Acquisition Code default

tablefield.name: a_default_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: s_failed_login_time_i
tablefield.descr: The last time a user failed to log in
tablefield.label: Last Failed Login Time

tablefield.name: s_failed_login_date_d
tablefield.descr: The last date a user failed to log in.
tablefield.label: Last Failed Login Date

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: If the user has a Partner record this is the key to it
tablefield.label: Partner Key
tablefield.help: Enter the partner key of the user if they have a Partner record

table.name: s_user_account_activity
table.descr: Logs activity on user accounts themselves (user logins and logouts are recorded in s_login)
table.label: User Account Activity

tablefield.name: s_user_id_c
tablefield.descr: User for which the user account activity got recorded.

tablefield.name: s_activity_date_d
tablefield.descr: Date of the recorded user account activity.
tablefield.label: Activity Date

tablefield.name: s_activity_time_i
tablefield.descr: Time of the recorded user account activity.
tablefield.label: Activity Time

tablefield.name: s_activity_type_c
tablefield.descr: Type of the recorded account activity. This is a hard-coded constant value (there's no 'lookup table' for it); for available values and their meaning please check program code (TUserAccountActivityLog Class).
tablefield.label: Account Activity Type

tablefield.name: s_activity_details_c
tablefield.descr: Details/description of the recorded account activity. This is a localised string, i.e. it can be recorded in the language of the Site! Refer to s_activity_type_c for exact identification of what the recorded account activity is about if text in here can't be understood because it is recorded in a foreign language.
tablefield.label: Account Activity Details

table.name: s_login
table.descr: Log of all the log-ins/log-in attempts to the system, and of log-outs from the system (activities on user accounts themselves are recorded in s_user_account_activity).
table.label: Login

tablefield.name: s_login_process_id_r
tablefield.descr: OpenPetra process ID; this is a unique key

tablefield.name: s_user_id_c
tablefield.descr: This is the system user id. Each user of the system is allocated one.
tablefield.label: User ID

tablefield.name: s_time_i
tablefield.descr: Time of the login/login attempt/logout.
tablefield.label: Login Time

tablefield.name: s_date_d
tablefield.descr: Date of the login/login attempt/logout.
tablefield.label: Login Date

tablefield.name: s_login_type_c
tablefield.descr: Type of the login/logout record. This is a hard-coded constant value (there's no 'lookup table' for it); for available values and their meaning please check program code (TLoginLog Class).
tablefield.label: Login Type

tablefield.name: s_login_details_c
tablefield.descr: Details/description of the login/login attempt/logout. This is a localised string, i.e. it can be recorded in the language of the Site! Refer to s_login_type_c for exact identification of what the recorded account activity is about if text in here can't be understood because it is recorded in a foreign language.
tablefield.label: Login Status

tablefield.name: s_login_process_id_ref_i
tablefield.descr: Reference to s_login_process_id_r (OpenPetra process ID of the login record) - only set for a record of s_login_status_type_c 'LOGOUT' (connects the logout log entry with the corresponding login log entry.)

tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.descr:
This defines if the partner status code can be deleted.
This can only be updated by the system manager.
At the risk of serious operational integrity.
Default to Yes
tablefield.label: Deletable
tablefield.help: This code is Required for System operation by other code

table.name: p_acquisition
table.descr: This table is used to describe how a partner first came into contact with the organisation. Which department entered them.
table.label: Acquisition

tablefield.name: p_acquisition_code_c
tablefield.descr: This code identifies the method of aquisition.
tablefield.label: Acquisition Code
tablefield.help: How has this Partner entered this system? By which Dept?

tablefield.name: p_acquisition_description_c
tablefield.descr: This describes the method of aquisition.
tablefield.label: Description
tablefield.help: Enter the code description of how the partner was acquired

tablefield.name: p_valid_acquisition_l
tablefield.descr: Defines if the acquisition code is still for use
tablefield.label: Assignable
tablefield.help: Select if this Acquisition Code is still in Use

tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.descr:
This defines if the acquisition code can be deleted.
This can only be updated by the system manager.
At the risk of serious operational integrity.
Default to Yes
tablefield.label: Deletable
tablefield.help: This code is Required for System operation by other code

tablefield.name: p_recruiting_effort_l
tablefield.descr: This defines if the acquisition code listed represents a recruiting effort.
tablefield.label: Recruiting Effort
tablefield.help: Indicates if acquisition code represents a recruiting effort.

table.name: p_addressee_type
table.descr: Ex. Fam - Family, SM - Single Male, etc.
table.label: Addressee Type

tablefield.name: p_addressee_type_code_c
tablefield.label: Addressee Type Code
tablefield.help: Enter an addressee type code

tablefield.name: p_description_c
tablefield.label: Description
tablefield.help: Enter a description

tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.descr:
This defines if the addressee type code can be deleted.
This can only be updated by the system manager.
At the risk of serious operational integrity.
Default to Yes
tablefield.label: Deletable
tablefield.help: This code is Required for System operation by other code

table.name: p_title
table.descr: Titles available for use
table.label: Title

tablefield.name: p_title_c
tablefield.label: Title
tablefield.help: Enter a title

tablefield.name: p_default_addressee_type_code_c
tablefield.descr: Default addressee type code to be used for this title
tablefield.label: Default Addresse Type
tablefield.help: Enter the default addressee type to be used for this title

tablefield.name: p_common_title_l
tablefield.descr: This defines if the title is a common one to be used more often in this system
tablefield.label: Common Title
tablefield.help: This title is a common one

table.name: p_partner_classes
table.descr: The class a partner is (PERSON, UNIT, etc.
table.label: Partner Classes

table.name: p_partner
table.descr: This is the main table of the partner system. Partners can be individuals, families, organisations (churches, businesses), fields, cost centers, and others. These represent various classes of partners.
table.label: Partner

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: This is the partner key assigned to each partner. It consists of the fund id followed by a computer generated six digit number.
tablefield.label: Partner Key
tablefield.help: Enter the partner key (SiteID + Number)

tablefield.name: p_partner_class_c
tablefield.descr: This defines what type of partner this is. The classes that may be assigned are PERSON, FAMILY, CHURCH, ORGANISATION, UNIT, VENUE and BANK.
tablefield.label: Partner Class
tablefield.help: Select a partner class

tablefield.name: p_addressee_type_code_c
tablefield.descr: This is a sub-class of the partner class.
tablefield.label: Addressee Type Code
tablefield.help: Enter an addressee type code

tablefield.name: p_partner_short_name_c
tablefield.descr: Name of the person or organisation. If a person, more name info is stored in p_person.
tablefield.label: Short Name
tablefield.help: Enter a short name for this partner

tablefield.name: p_partner_short_name_loc_c
tablefield.descr: An alternative name for a partner - mainly for entering the local language equivalent.
tablefield.label: Short Name (Local)
tablefield.help: Enter a short name for this partner in your local language

tablefield.name: p_printed_name_c
tablefield.descr:
Partner name how it should appear as printed version (to be used if mechanism
to build short name from first and last name does not work e.g. in case of different surnames for husband and wife)
tablefield.label: Printed Name
tablefield.help: Enter the name that can be used for printing if normal mechanism can not be used

tablefield.name: p_language_code_c
tablefield.descr: Identifies the preferred language of the partner.
tablefield.label: Language Code
tablefield.help: Select the partner's preferred language

tablefield.name: p_key_information_c
tablefield.descr: Important information about this partner that users need to be aware of.
tablefield.label: Key Information
tablefield.help: Important information about this partner that users need to be aware of

tablefield.name: p_comment_c
tablefield.descr: Additional information about the partner that is important to store in the database.
tablefield.label: Comments
tablefield.help: Enter any additional comments (if full, use notebook)

tablefield.name: p_acquisition_code_c
tablefield.descr: This code identifies the method of aquisition.
tablefield.label: Acquisition Code
tablefield.help: Select a method-of-acquisition code

tablefield.name: p_status_code_c
tablefield.descr:
This code describes the status of a partner.
Eg, Active, Deceased etc
tablefield.label: Partner Status
tablefield.help: Select a partner status

tablefield.name: p_status_change_d
tablefield.descr: This is the date the status of the partner was last updated.
tablefield.label: Status Updated
tablefield.help: Date when status field was updated

tablefield.name: p_status_change_reason_c
tablefield.descr: Why was the status changed?
tablefield.label: Reason for Status Change
tablefield.help: What is the reason for this change of status?

tablefield.name: p_deleted_partner_l
tablefield.descr: Yes if this partner has been ""deleted.""
tablefield.label: Deleted Partner
tablefield.help: Select if partner has been deleted or removed

tablefield.name: p_finance_comment_c
tablefield.descr: This is the finance details comment.
tablefield.label: Comment
tablefield.help: Enter any finance related comments for this partner.

tablefield.name: p_receipt_letter_frequency_c
tablefield.descr: How often the partner receives a receipt letter.
tablefield.label: Receipt frequency
tablefield.help: Enter how often the partner wants a receipt

tablefield.name: p_receipt_each_gift_l
tablefield.descr: Flags whether each gift given by a user is receipted
tablefield.label: Receipt Each Gift
tablefield.help: Does the partner want a receipt for each gift?

tablefield.name: p_email_gift_statement_l
tablefield.descr: Flag whether to include this partner when running the Recipient Gift Email report
tablefield.label: Email Gift Statement
tablefield.help: Include this partner in the Recipient Gift Email report?

tablefield.name: p_anonymous_donor_l
tablefield.descr: Yes if the donor wants to remain anonymous. Names of anonymous donors will not appear on recipient gift statements.
tablefield.label: Anonymous Donor ?
tablefield.help: Set this when the partner wishes to donate anonymously

tablefield.name: p_no_solicitations_l
tablefield.descr: Yes if not ok to solicit the partner for funds.
tablefield.label: No Solicitations ?
tablefield.help: Set this if the partner does not want extra mailings

tablefield.name: p_child_indicator_l
tablefield.descr: Inicates if this partner has been assigned as a child unit to another unit.
tablefield.help: Indicates if partner is a child unit to another unit

tablefield.name: p_restricted_i
tablefield.descr: Restricts use of the partner record to the user in p_user_id_c if 2 or the group in p_group_id_c if 1.
tablefield.label: Restrictions
tablefield.help: Indicate partner is a User, Group or neither

tablefield.name: p_user_id_c
tablefield.descr: The Petra user that the partner record is restricted to if p_restricted_i is 2.
tablefield.label: User ID
tablefield.help: Select a corresponding User Restriction

tablefield.name: p_group_id_c
tablefield.descr: The group of Petra users that the partner record is restricted to if p_restricted_i is 1.
tablefield.label: Group ID
tablefield.help: Select the corresponding Group Restriction

tablefield.name: p_previous_name_c
tablefield.label: Previous Name
tablefield.help: Enter the previously used Surname (eg before marriage)

tablefield.name: p_first_contact_code_c
tablefield.descr: How did this Partner first hear about us?

tablefield.name: p_first_contact_freeform_c
tablefield.descr: How did this Partner first hear about us (freetext)?

tablefield.name: p_intranet_id_c
tablefield.descr: Intranet ID. Needed for making the link to the International Website, e.g. for using the Online Address Book.

tablefield.name: p_timezone_c
tablefield.descr:
Timezone that applies to the partner (address does not necessarily determine that).
This refers to data in the International Address Book.

table.name: p_recent_partners
table.descr: The partners a user has been working with recently
table.label: Recent Partners

tablefield.name: p_when_d
tablefield.descr: When was this partner edited by this user?

tablefield.name: s_user_id_c
tablefield.descr: Who is this for

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: What partner is it about?

table.name: p_partner_graphic
table.descr: Any graphic associated to a partner can be stored here.
table.label: Partner Graphic

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: This is the partner key assigned to each partner. It consists of the fund id followed by a computer generated six digit number.
tablefield.label: Partner Key
tablefield.help: Enter the partner key (SiteID + Number)

tablefield.name: p_graphic_label_c
tablefield.descr: The label for the graphic related to the partner.
tablefield.label: Graphic Label Name
tablefield.help: Enter a short description (e.g. Photograph, Map etc)

table.name: p_location
table.descr: Address and other data related to that address.
table.label: Location

tablefield.name: p_site_key_n
tablefield.descr: This is the key that tell what site created this location, it will help to merge addresses when doing imports
tablefield.label: Site Key

tablefield.name: p_building_1_c
tablefield.descr: The name of the building

tablefield.name: p_building_2_c
tablefield.descr: The name of the building (continued)
tablefield.label: Building (cont.)

tablefield.name: p_street_name_c
tablefield.descr: The name of the street that the house is located on

tablefield.name: p_locality_c
tablefield.descr: This is the first element of an address
tablefield.label: Addr1
tablefield.help: The part of the address preceding the street, eg business name

tablefield.name: p_suburb_c
tablefield.descr: The name of the suburb
tablefield.label: Suburb

tablefield.name: p_city_c

tablefield.label: City

tablefield.name: p_county_c
tablefield.descr: This can be a county (UK), a state (US), province (CDN), canton (CH) etc.

tablefield.name: p_postal_code_c
tablefield.descr: This is the national post code

tablefield.name: p_country_code_c
tablefield.descr:
This is a code which identifies a country.
It is taken from the ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 code elements.
tablefield.label: Country Code
tablefield.help: Select a country code

tablefield.name: p_address_3_c
tablefield.descr: This is the third element of an address (if required)
tablefield.label: Addr3
tablefield.help: Enter the third part of the address, eg district of the city

tablefield.name: p_geo_latitude_n
tablefield.descr: The latitude of the location; a number between -90 and +90; precision is 6 digits (11cm)

tablefield.name: p_geo_longitude_n
tablefield.descr: The longitude of the location; a number between -180 and +180; precision is 6 digits (11cm)

tablefield.name: p_geo_km_x_i
tablefield.descr: The distance in km of this location to the location 0 if location 0 was on the same longitude; this is for improving query performance

tablefield.name: p_geo_km_y_i
tablefield.descr: The distance in km of this location to the location 0 if location 0 was on the same latitude; this is for improving query performance

tablefield.name: p_geo_accuracy_i
p_restricted_l
tablefield.descr: Indicates whether or not the location has restricted access. If it does then the access will be controlled by s_group_location.
tablefield.label: Location Restricted
tablefield.help: Should access to this location be restricted to some people?

index.name: p_geo_location_km_k
index.descr: improve speed of reports on square area

table.name: p_location_type

index.name: p_email_address_k
index.descr: for quicker searches, from Mail application etc.

table.name: p_partner_attribute_category
table.descr: Holds categories that categorise Partner Attributes Types, thus allowing logical grouping of the latter (e.g. to have all Partner Attributes Types that are to do with phone numbers in one category).
table.label: Partner Attribute Category

tablefield.name: p_category_code_c
tablefield.descr: Code for Partner Attribute Category. Use plural words/phrases (e.g. 'Phone Numbers' and not 'Phone Number')
tablefield.label: Category Code
tablefield.help: Enter the code for the Partner Attribute Category

tablefield.name: p_category_desc_c
tablefield.descr: Description for Partner Attribute Category.
tablefield.label: Description
tablefield.help: Enter a description for the Partner Attribute Category

tablefield.name: p_index_i
tablefield.descr: Allows for manual ordering of Partner Attribute Categories by the user (e.g. list Partner Attribute Types for 'phone numbers' first, then list all for 'mobile numbers').
tablefield.label: Index

tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether Partner Attribute Types that are linked to this Partner Attribute Category are 'Partner Contact Detail' Attributes or not.
tablefield.name: p_partner_contact_category_l
tablefield.label: Partner Contact Detail Category

tablefield.name: p_system_category_l
tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute Category is one that is internally used by OpenPetra. Records that have this Flag set will be hidden from the user altogether (and so will p_partner_attribute records that are linked to such a Category through a p_partner_attribute_type!!!).
tablefield.label: Is Deletable

tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute Category is deletable by a user or not. Should be set to be true for records where p_system_category_l is true.
tablefield.label: Is Deletable

table.name: p_partner_attribute_type
table.descr: Holds various Partner Attribute Types.
table.label: Partner Attribute Type

tablefield.descr: Category of the Partner Attribute Type.
tablefield.name: p_category_code_c
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Category

tablefield.descr: Attribute Type. This can be anything really: Phone Number, Mobile Number, Email Address, etc (not limited to Partner Contact Details, though). Use singular words/phrases (e.g. 'Phone Number' and not 'Phone Numbers').
tablefield.name: p_attribute_type_c
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Code

tablefield.descr: Description of what this Partner Attribute Type is all about.
tablefield.name: p_description_c
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Type Description

tablefield.name: p_index_i
tablefield.descr: Allows for manual ordering of Partner Attribute Types by the user (e.g. to list all Partner Attributes that have a Partner Attribute Type of 'phone number' *grouped together* first, then list all that have a Partner Attribute Type of 'assistant phone number' *grouped together*).
tablefield.label: Index

tablefield.descr: Describes the kind (type) of Value that the Partner Attributes that are linked to this Partner Attribute Type are. Valid values for Contact Detail Attributes: 'CONTACTDETAIL_GENERAL', 'CONTACTDETAIL_HYPERLINK', 'CONTACTDETAIL_HYPERLINK_WITHVALUE', 'CONTACTDETAIL_EMAILADDRESS', 'CONTACTDETAIL_SKYPEID'.
tablefield.name: p_attribute_type_value_kind_c
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Type Value Kind

tablefield.descr: For use with p_attribute_type_value_kind_c 'CONTACTDETAIL_HYPERLINK_WITHVALUE' only. Specifies how to 'construct' a hyperlink where the Value of a Partner Attribute is part of the URL.
tablefield.name: p_hyperlink_format_c
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Type Hyperlink Format

tablefield.descr: Label that should be displayed/printed instead of p_code_c if a Partner Attribute's 'specialised' Flag is set.
tablefield.name: p_special_label_c
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Type Special Label

tablefield.name: p_unassignable_l
tablefield.descr: Can this Partner Attribute Type be assigned?
tablefield.label: Unassignable?

tablefield.name: p_unassignable_date_d
tablefield.descr: This is the date where the record was set to unassignable.
tablefield.label: Date

tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute Type is deletable by a user or not.
tablefield.name: p_deletable_l
tablefield.label: Is Deletable

table.name: p_partner_attribute
table.descr: Mainly introduced for Partner Contact Details like email addresses and (mobile) phone numbers, but can be used for any attribute we might want to save for a Partner.
table.label: Partner Attribute

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: This is the partner key assigned to each partner. It consists of the fund id followed by a computer generated six digit number.
tablefield.label: Partner Key
tablefield.help: Enter the partner key (SiteID + Number)

tablefield.descr: The Partner Attribute Type that the Partner Attribute that is assigned here has got.
tablefield.name: p_attribute_type_c
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Type

tablefield.name: p_sequence_i
tablefield.descr: A normal sequence so that each partner can have more than one value for any particular attribute type.
tablefield.label: Sequence

tablefield.name: p_index_i
tablefield.descr: Allows for manual ordering of Partner Attributes within a Partner Attribute Type by the user (e.g. re-ordering of phone numbers within the 'Phone Number' Partner Attribute Type).
tablefield.label: Index

tablefield.name: p_value_c
tablefield.descr: The value of the attribute.
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Value

tablefield.name: p_value_country_c
tablefield.descr: The country of the value of the attribute (only relevant for Telephone and Fax Numbers).
tablefield.label: Partner Attribute Value Country

tablefield.name: p_comment_c
tablefield.descr: Any comment to explain this attribute value, or some additional info that may be required.
tablefield.label: Comment

tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute is the primary one among several that have the same Partner Attribute Type.
tablefield.name: p_primary_l
tablefield.label: Is Primary

tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute is for use within The Organisation.
tablefield.name: p_within_organisation_l
tablefield.label: Is Within The Organisation

tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute is specialised. For Partner Contact Details this flag is set for work-related Partner Attribute Types. The label is set in p_partner_attribute_type.p_special_label_c, eg. Business
tablefield.name: p_specialised_l
tablefield.label: Is Specialised

tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute is confidential.
tablefield.name: p_confidential_l
tablefield.label: Is Confidential

tablefield.descr: Flag to indicate whether this Partner Attribute is current.
tablefield.name: p_current_l
tablefield.label: Is Current

tablefield.name: p_no_longer_current_from_d
tablefield.descr: When this Partner Attribute value is no longer current from.
tablefield.label: No Longer Current From

table.name: a_batch
table.descr: Store current and forward period general ledger batches for a ledger.
table.label: Batch

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: The ledger that the batch belongs to.
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_batch_number_i
tablefield.descr: Identifies the batch.
tablefield.label: Batch Number

tablefield.name: a_batch_description_c
tablefield.descr: This is a long description and is 80 characters long.
tablefield.label: Batch Description
tablefield.help: Enter a description for this general ledger batch.

tablefield.name: a_batch_control_total_n
tablefield.descr: Raw total amount of the batch. If the journals within the batch have different currencies, this is just a raw numeric sum of all the journal amounts. It does not reflect a monetary value in a specific currency. Entered by the user.
tablefield.label: Batch Control Total
tablefield.help: (Optional) Enter the total amount of the batch (hash total).

tablefield.name: a_batch_running_total_n
tablefield.descr: Running total amount of the batch calculated as transactions are enterd. If the journals within the batch have different currencies, this is just a raw numeric sum of all the journal amounts. It does not reflect a monetary value in a specific currency.
tablefield.label: Batch Running Total
tablefield.help: Enter the amount

tablefield.name: a_batch_debit_total_n
tablefield.descr: Raw debit total amount of the batch. If the journals within the batch have different currencies, this is just a raw numeric sum of all the journal amounts. It does not reflect a monetary value in a specific currency.
tablefield.label: Batch Debit Total
tablefield.help: Total amount of debits.

tablefield.name: a_batch_credit_total_n
tablefield.descr: Raw credit total amount of the batch. If the journals within the batch have different currencies, this is just a raw numeric sum of all the journal amounts. It does not reflect a monetary value in a specific currency.
tablefield.label: Batch Credit Total
tablefield.help: Total amount of credits.

tablefield.name: a_batch_period_i
tablefield.descr: This identifies which accounting period that the batch belongs to.
tablefield.label: Batch Period Number
tablefield.help: Enter a number between 1 and 20

tablefield.name: a_batch_year_i
tablefield.descr: The number of the accounting year
tablefield.label: Batch Period Year Number

tablefield.name: a_date_effective_d
tablefield.descr: Date the batch comes into effect
tablefield.label: Effective Date
tablefield.help: Enter the date for which this batch is to take effect.

tablefield.name: a_date_of_entry_d
tablefield.descr: Date the batch was created.
tablefield.label: Entry Date
tablefield.help: Date the batch was created.

tablefield.name: a_batch_status_c
tablefield.descr: Has this batch been posted yet?
tablefield.label: Batch status
tablefield.help: Shows the status of the batch.

tablefield.name: a_last_journal_i
tablefield.descr: Identifies a journal within a batch
tablefield.label: Last Journal Number
tablefield.help: Last number used for a journal.

tablefield.name: a_gift_batch_number_i
tablefield.descr: Number of the originating gift batch that generated this GL batch.
tablefield.label: Originating Gift Batch Number
tablefield.help: The number of the gift batch that generated this GL batch.

table.name: a_journal
table.descr: Holds details of each general ledger journal, which contains a group of transactions.
table.label: Journal

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: The journal belongs to this ledger.
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_batch_number_i
tablefield.descr: identifes which batch the journal belongs to.
tablefield.label: Batch Number
tablefield.help: The number of the batch containing this journal.

tablefield.name: a_journal_number_i
tablefield.descr: Identifies a journal within a batch
tablefield.label: Journal Number
tablefield.help: The number of this journal.

tablefield.name: a_journal_description_c
tablefield.descr: This is a long description and is 80 characters long.
tablefield.label: Journal Description
tablefield.help: Enter a description for this general ledger journal.

tablefield.name: a_journal_debit_total_n
tablefield.descr: This is a number of currency units in the currency of the transaction.
tablefield.label: Journal Debit Total
tablefield.help: The total amount of debits.

tablefield.name: a_journal_credit_total_n
tablefield.descr: This is the number of currency units in the currency of the transaction.
tablefield.label: Journal Credit Total
tablefield.help: The total amount of credits.

tablefield.name: a_journal_period_i
tablefield.descr: This defines which accounting period is being used
tablefield.label: Journal Period Number
tablefield.help: The financial period of the journal (same as the batch).

tablefield.name: a_date_effective_d
tablefield.descr: Date the journal comes into effect.
tablefield.label: Date Effective
tablefield.help: Enter the date for the journal to come into effect.

tablefield.name: a_transaction_type_code_c
tablefield.descr: Which type of journal is this? Eg. STD, ALLOC, REALLOC, REVAL.
tablefield.label: Transaction Type
tablefield.help: Select the type of journal.

tablefield.name: a_last_transaction_number_i
tablefield.descr: The number of the last transaction within the journal.
tablefield.label: Last Transaction Number
tablefield.help: The number of the last transaction created in the journal.

tablefield.name: a_sub_system_code_c
tablefield.descr: Indicates the sub system of accounts that the journal belongs to. Eg. GL, AP, GR
tablefield.label: Sub System
tablefield.help: The subsystem from which this journal came.

tablefield.name: a_journal_status_c
tablefield.descr: Has a journal been posted yet
tablefield.label: Journal Status
tablefield.help: The posting status of the journal.

tablefield.name: a_transaction_currency_c
tablefield.descr: This defines which currency is being used
tablefield.label: Transaction Currency
tablefield.help: Select a currency code to use for the journal transactions.

tablefield.name: a_exchange_rate_to_base_n
tablefield.descr: The rate of exchange from the transaction currency (in a_transaction_currency_c) to the ledger base currency.
tablefield.label: Exchange Rate to Base
tablefield.help: Enter the exchange rate from the transaction currency to base.

tablefield.name: a_exchange_rate_time_i
tablefield.descr: The time component of the exchange rate.
tablefield.label: Time (of Exchange Rate)
tablefield.help: The time component of the exchange rate.

tablefield.name: a_date_of_entry_d
tablefield.descr: Date the journal was created.
tablefield.label: Entry Date
tablefield.help: Date the journal was created.

tablefield.name: a_reversed_l
tablefield.descr: Indicates whether or not a journal has been reversed.
tablefield.label: Journal Reversed?

table.name: a_revaluation
table.descr: Holds information used specifically in revaluations. The table extends the a_journal table.
table.label: Revaluation

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: The revaluation journal belongs to this ledger.
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_batch_number_i
tablefield.descr: identifes which batch the revaluation journal belongs to.
tablefield.label: Batch Number
tablefield.help: The number of the batch containing this journal.

tablefield.name: a_journal_number_i
tablefield.descr: Identifies the revaluation journal within a batch (usually 1)
tablefield.label: Journal Number
tablefield.help: The number of this journal.

tablefield.name: a_revaluation_currency_c
tablefield.descr: This defines which revaluation currency the rate applies to
tablefield.label: Revaluation Currency

tablefield.name: a_exchange_rate_to_base_n
tablefield.descr: The rate of exchange from the revaluation currency (in a_revaluation_currency_c) to the ledger base currency.
tablefield.label: Exchange Rate to Base

table.name: a_transaction
table.descr: Detailed information for each debit and credit in a general ledger journal.
table.label: Transaction

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_batch_number_i
tablefield.descr: identifes which batch a transaction belongs to
tablefield.label: Batch Number
tablefield.help: The number of the batch containing this transaction.

tablefield.name: a_journal_number_i
tablefield.label: Journal Number
tablefield.help: The number of the journal containing the transaction.

tablefield.name: a_transaction_number_i
tablefield.descr: Identifies a transaction within a journal within a batch within a ledger
tablefield.label: Transaction Number
tablefield.help: The number of this transaction within the journal.

tablefield.name: a_account_code_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies the account the financial transaction must be stored against
tablefield.label: Account Code
tablefield.help: Enter an account code.

tablefield.name: a_primary_account_code_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies the account the financial transaction must be stored against [NOT USED]
tablefield.label: Primary Account Code
tablefield.help: Enter an account code

tablefield.name: a_cost_centre_code_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies which cost centre an account is applied to
tablefield.label: Cost Centre Code
tablefield.help: Enter a cost centre code (department or fund).

tablefield.name: a_primary_cost_centre_code_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies which cost centre an account is applied to [NOT USED]
tablefield.label: Primary Cost Centre Code
tablefield.help: Enter a cost centre code

tablefield.name: a_transaction_date_d
tablefield.descr: Date the transaction took place
tablefield.label: Transaction Date
tablefield.help: The date the transaction is to take effect (same as journal).

tablefield.name: a_transaction_amount_n
tablefield.descr: This is a number of currency units
tablefield.label: Transaction Amount
tablefield.help: Enter the transaction amount.

tablefield.name: a_amount_in_base_currency_n
tablefield.descr: This is a number of currency units
tablefield.label: Amount in Base Currency
tablefield.help: The transaction amount converted to the base currency.

tablefield.name: a_analysis_indicator_l
tablefield.descr: Used to get a yes no response from the user
tablefield.label: Analysis Indicator
tablefield.help: Enter Yes or No

tablefield.name: a_reconciled_status_l
tablefield.descr: shows if the transaction has been reconciled or not

tablefield.name: a_narrative_c
tablefield.label: Narrative
tablefield.help: Enter a description of the transaction.

tablefield.name: a_debit_credit_indicator_l
tablefield.label: Debit/Credit Indicator
tablefield.help: Is the transaction a debit or credit?

tablefield.name: a_transaction_status_l
tablefield.descr: Has a transaction been posted yet
tablefield.label: Transaction Posted Status
tablefield.help: Posting status of the transaction.

tablefield.name: a_header_number_i
tablefield.descr: The header (eg, cashbook #) that the transaction is associated with. [NOT USED]
tablefield.label: Header Number

tablefield.name: a_detail_number_i
tablefield.descr: The detail (within the header) that the transaction is associated with. [NOT USED]
tablefield.label: Detail Number

tablefield.name: a_to_ilt_flag_l
tablefield.descr: Indicates whether the ILT transaction has been transferred to transaction for ILT file.
tablefield.label: Transferred to ILT Ledger

tablefield.name: a_source_flag_l
tablefield.descr: To flag a transaction as having come from a source ledger and been processed in an ilt processing centre
tablefield.label: Source Transaction

tablefield.name: a_reference_c
tablefield.descr: Reference number/code for the transaction
tablefield.label: Reference
tablefield.help: (Optional) Enter a reference code.

tablefield.name: a_source_reference_c
tablefield.descr: Transaction key which initiated an ILT transaction
tablefield.label: Source Reference

tablefield.name: a_system_generated_l
tablefield.descr: Was this transaction generated automatically by the system?
tablefield.label: System Generated
tablefield.help: Was this transaction generated automatically by the system?

tablefield.name: a_amount_in_intl_currency_n
tablefield.descr: The transaction amount in the second base currency.
tablefield.label: Amount in International Currency
tablefield.help: The transaction amount converted to the 'second' base currency.

tablefield.name: a_ich_number_i
tablefield.descr: identifes the ICH process number
tablefield.label: ICH Process Number

tablefield.name: a_key_ministry_key_n
tablefield.descr: Key ministry to which this transaction applies (just for fund transfers)
tablefield.label: Key Ministry

table.name: a_trans_anal_attrib
table.descr: Analysis information entered by the user for a general ledger transaction.
table.label: Transaction Analysis Attribute

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_batch_number_i
tablefield.descr: identifes which batch a transaction belongs to
tablefield.label: Batch Number

tablefield.name: a_journal_number_i
tablefield.descr: Identifies a journal within a batch
tablefield.label: Journal Number

tablefield.name: a_transaction_number_i
tablefield.descr: Identifies a transaction within a journal within a batch within a ledger
tablefield.label: Transaction Number

tablefield.name: a_account_code_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies the account the financial transaction must be stored against
tablefield.label: Account Code
tablefield.help: Enter an account code

tablefield.name: a_cost_centre_code_c
tablefield.descr: Cost Centre to which the attribute relates
tablefield.label: Cost Centre Code
tablefield.help: Enter a cost centre code

table.name: a_suspense_account
table.descr: Lists the suspense accounts of each ledger.
table.label: Suspense Account

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_suspense_account_code_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies an account which will be treated as a suspense account.
tablefield.label: Suspense Account Code
tablefield.help: Enter an account code

table.name: a_special_trans_type
table.descr: Transaction types which have special processing. Eg. Allocation, Reallocation, Gift, Revaluation.

tablefield.name: a_sub_system_code_c
tablefield.descr: Defines a sub system of accounts
tablefield.label: Sub System Code

tablefield.name: a_transaction_type_description_c
tablefield.descr: This is a short description which is 32 charcters long
tablefield.label: Description
tablefield.help: Enter a description

tablefield.name: a_spec_trans_process_to_call_c
tablefield.descr: The filename of the process to call
tablefield.label: Process to Call

tablefield.descr: Process to call to undo the work of the special transaction process, if needed

table.name: a_system_interface
table.descr: Shows which systems are interfaced (have been added) to each general ledger.
table.label: System Interface

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_sub_system_code_c
tablefield.descr: Defines a sub system of accounts
tablefield.label: Sub System Code

table.name: a_currency_language
table.descr: Describes what is to be displayed for a currency and language combination when displaying the amount as text.
table.label: Currency Language

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: This defines which currency is being used
tablefield.label: Currency Code
tablefield.help: Currency code

tablefield.name: p_language_code_c
tablefield.descr: This is the code used to identify a language.
tablefield.label: Language Code
tablefield.help: Enter an internationally accepted language code

tablefield.name: a_unit_label_singular_c
tablefield.descr: The currency unit label when the amount is 1
tablefield.label: Singular
tablefield.help: Enter the label for the unit when the amount is 1

tablefield.name: a_unit_label_plural_c
tablefield.descr: The currency unit label when the amount is > 1
tablefield.label: Plural
tablefield.help: Enter the label for the unit when the amount is > 1

tablefield.name: a_special_code_c
tablefield.descr: This is needed to determine the gender in some languages.
tablefield.label: Special Code

tablefield.name: a_decimal_options_c
tablefield.descr: Describes what to do with the decimal when representing it as text. Not to display, display as text or as a numeric
tablefield.label: Decimal Option
tablefield.help: Enter the option required

tablefield.name: a_decimal_label_singular_c
tablefield.descr: The currency decimal label when the amount is 1
tablefield.label: Singular
tablefield.help: Enter the label for the decimal when the amount is 1

tablefield.name: a_decimal_label_plural_c
tablefield.descr: The currency decimal label when the amount is > 1
tablefield.label: Plural
tablefield.help: Enter the label for the decimal when the amount is > 1

table.name: a_ap_supplier
table.descr: This table defines the concept of a supplier in the AP system and is the centre of the AP system.
table.label: AP Supplier

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: Reference to the partner key for this supplier

tablefield.name: a_preferred_screen_display_i
tablefield.descr: Number of months to display invoices and credit notes
tablefield.label: Preferred Screen Display

tablefield.name: a_default_bank_account_c
tablefield.descr: Reference to default bank account to use to pay supplier with.
tablefield.label: Default Bank Account

tablefield.name: a_payment_type_c
tablefield.descr: The default type of payment to use when paying this supplier.
tablefield.label: Default Payment Type

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: The currency code to use for this supplier.
tablefield.label: Currency

tablefield.name: a_default_ap_account_c
tablefield.descr: The default AP Account to use when paying this supplier.

tablefield.descr: Default credit terms to use for invoices from this supplier.

tablefield.name: a_default_discount_percentage_n
tablefield.descr: Default percentage discount to receive for early payments.

tablefield.name: a_default_discount_days_i
tablefield.descr: Default number of days in which the discount percentage has effect.
tablefield.label: Default Discount Days

tablefield.name: a_supplier_type_c
tablefield.descr: What type of supplier this is - normal, credit card, maybe something else.

tablefield.name: a_default_exp_account_c
tablefield.descr: Reference to the default expense Account to use for invoice details.

tablefield.name: a_default_cost_centre_c
tablefield.descr: Reference to the default cost centre to use for invoice details.

tablefield.name: a_our_reference_c
tablefield.descr: This reference identifies us to the supplier

table.name: a_ap_document
table.descr: Either an invoice or a credit note in the Accounts Payable system.
table.label: AP Document

tablefield.name: a_ap_document_id_i
tablefield.descr: Unique key for this record
tablefield.label: Unique Id

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: Reference to the ledger for this invoice.

tablefield.name: a_ap_number_i
tablefield.descr: A unique key (together with the ledger number) to identify this document.

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: Reference to the supplier that sent this invoice.

tablefield.name: a_credit_note_flag_l
tablefield.descr: A flag to indicate if this document is an invoice or a credit note.

tablefield.descr: The code given on the document itself (be it invoice or credit note). This will have to be unique for each supplier.

tablefield.name: a_reference_c
tablefield.descr: Some kind of other reference needed.

tablefield.name: a_date_issued_d
tablefield.descr: The date when this document was issued.
tablefield.label: Date Issued

tablefield.name: a_date_entered_d
tablefield.descr: The date when this document was entered into the system.

tablefield.name: a_credit_terms_i
tablefield.descr: Credit terms allowed for this invoice.

tablefield.name: a_total_amount_n
tablefield.descr: The total amount of money that this document is worth.
tablefield.label: Total Amount

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: the currency of the document

tablefield.name: a_exchange_rate_to_base_n
tablefield.descr: The exchange rate to the base currency at the time that the document was issued.
tablefield.label: Exchange Rate to Base

tablefield.name: a_discount_percentage_n
tablefield.descr: The percentage discount you get for early payment of this document in the case that it is an invoice.

tablefield.name: a_discount_days_i
tablefield.descr: The number of days that the discount is valid for (0 for none).

tablefield.name: a_ap_account_c
tablefield.descr: Reference to the AP Account to debit/credit when posting/paying the document.

tablefield.name: a_last_detail_number_i
tablefield.descr: The number of the last item for this document. This is used simply to quickly get the next number if items are added.

tablefield.name: a_document_status_c
tablefield.descr: The current status of the invoice. The value can (for now) be one of: OPEN, APPROVED, POSTED, PARTPAID, or PAID.
tablefield.label: Document Status

table.name: a_crdt_note_invoice_link
table.descr: This table receives a new entry when a credit note is applied to an invoice. Since the invoices and credit notes share the same table, we need a way to link the two, and this is the role of this table.

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: Reference to the ledger number.

tablefield.name: a_invoice_document_id_i

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: Reference to the ledger
tablefield.label: Ledger Number

tablefield.name: a_ap_document_id_i
tablefield.descr: Reference to the document
tablefield.label: AP Document

tablefield.name: a_detail_number_i
tablefield.descr: A unique number for this detail for its document.
tablefield.label: Detail Number

tablefield.name: a_detail_approved_l
tablefield.descr: Indicates if this detail has been approved or not.

tablefield.name: a_cost_centre_code_c
tablefield.descr: Reference to the cost centre to use for this detail.
tablefield.label: Cost Centre

tablefield.name: a_account_code_c
tablefield.descr: Reference to the account to use for this detail
tablefield.label: Account Code

tablefield.name: a_item_ref_c
tablefield.descr: Some other reference to the item.
tablefield.label: Reference

tablefield.name: a_narrative_c
tablefield.descr: A narrative about what this is.

tablefield.name: a_amount_n
tablefield.descr: The amount of money this detail is worth.

tablefield.name: a_approval_date_d
tablefield.descr: The date when this detail was approved.
tablefield.label: Date Approved

table.name: a_ap_payment
table.descr: Records all payments that have been made against an accounts payable detail.
table.label: AP Payment

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_payment_number_i
tablefield.descr: Unique number to identify each payment batch.
tablefield.label: Payment Number

tablefield.name: a_amount_n
tablefield.descr: The amount of money that was paid

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c

tablefield.name: a_exchange_rate_to_base_n

tablefield.name: a_amount_n

tablefield.descr: AP Document ref

tablefield.descr: Unique number to identify each payment batch.
tablefield.label: Payment Number

table.name: a_ap_anal_attrib
table.descr: Analysis Attributes applied to an AP for posting to the GL.
table.label: AP Analysis Attributes

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: The ledger that the attribute value is associated with.
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_ap_document_id_i

tablefield.label: AP Number

tablefield.name: a_detail_number_i
tablefield.descr: The detail number within the invoice/ accounts payable.

tablefield.name: a_account_code_c
tablefield.descr: This identifies the account the financial transaction must be stored against

tablefield.help: Enter an account code

table.name: a_ar_category
table.descr: there are several categories that are can use invoicing: catering, hospitality, store and fees
table.label: Invoicing Category

tablefield.name: a_ar_category_code_c
tablefield.descr: categories help to specify certain discounts and group articles etc

tablefield.name: a_ar_description_c
tablefield.descr: description of this category

tablefield.name: a_ar_local_description_c
tablefield.descr: description of this category in the local language

table.name: a_ar_article
table.descr: defines an item that can be sold or a service that can be charged for; this can be used for catering, hospitality, store and fees; it can describe a specific book, or a group of equally priced books
table.label: Chargeable Item

tablefield.name: a_ar_article_code_c
tablefield.descr: code that uniquely identifies the item; can also be a code of a group of equally priced items

tablefield.name: a_ar_category_code_c
tablefield.descr: this article belongs to a certain category (catering, hospitality, store, fees)

tablefield.name: a_tax_type_code_c
tablefield.descr: this article falls into a special tax/VAT category

tablefield.name: a_ar_specific_article_l
tablefield.descr: describes whether this describes a specific item, e.g. book, or a group of equally priced items

tablefield.name: a_ar_description_c
tablefield.descr: description of this article

tablefield.name: a_ar_local_description_c
tablefield.descr: description of this article in the local language

table.name: a_ar_article_price
table.descr: assign a price to an article, which can be updated by time
table.label: Article Price

tablefield.name: a_ar_article_code_c
tablefield.descr: code that identifies the item to be sold or service to be charged

tablefield.name: a_ar_date_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: date from which this price is valid

tablefield.name: a_ar_amount_n
tablefield.descr: the value of the item in base currency
tablefield.label: Amount in Base Currency

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: the currency in which the price is given

table.name: a_ar_discount
table.descr: defines a discount that depends on other conditions or can just be assigned to an invoice or article
table.label: Discount

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_code_c

tablefield.name: a_ar_date_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: date from which this discount is valid

tablefield.name: a_ar_adhoc_l
tablefield.descr: this discount has only be created on the fly and should not be reusable elsewhere

tablefield.name: a_active_l
tablefield.descr: flag that prevents this discount from being used, to avoid too long lists in comboboxes etc

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_percentage_n
tablefield.descr: discount percentage; can be negative for expensive rooms etc

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_absolute_n
tablefield.descr: the absolute discount that is substracted from the article price; can be negative as well

tablefield.name: a_ar_absolute_amount_n
tablefield.descr: the absolute amount that is charged if this discount applies; e.g. 3 books for 5 Pound

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: the currency in which the absolute discount or amount is given

tablefield.name: a_ar_number_of_items_i
tablefield.descr: this discount applies for this number of items that are bought at the same time

tablefield.name: a_ar_minimum_number_of_items_i
tablefield.descr: this discount applies for all of the items if at least this number of items is bought at the same time

tablefield.name: a_ar_number_of_nights_i
tablefield.descr: this discount applies for this number of nights that the individual or group stays; this is needed because 100 people staying for one night do cost more than 50 people staying for 2 nights

tablefield.name: a_ar_minimum_number_of_nights_i
tablefield.descr: this discount applies for all of the nights if the individual or group stays at least for the given amount of nights; this is needed because 100 people staying for one night do cost more than 50 people staying for 2 nights

tablefield.name: a_ar_whole_room_l
tablefield.descr: this discount applies when a whole room is booked rather than just a bed

tablefield.name: a_ar_children_l
tablefield.descr: this discount applies for a children (e.g. meals)

tablefield.name: a_ar_early_booking_days_i
tablefield.descr: this discount applies when the booking has been done so many days before the stay (using ph_booking.ph_confirmed_d and ph_in_d)

tablefield.name: a_ar_early_payment_days_i
tablefield.descr: this discount applies when the payment has been received within the given number of days after the invoice has been charged

tablefield.name: a_ar_article_code_c
tablefield.descr: this discount applies if the article code matches

tablefield.name: p_partner_type_code_c
tablefield.descr: this discounts applies to partners of this type

table.name: a_ar_discount_per_category
table.descr: defines which discount applies to which category to limit the options in the UI
table.label: Available Discount per Category

tablefield.name: a_ar_category_code_c
tablefield.descr: refers to a certain category (catering, hospitality, store, fees)

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_code_c
tablefield.descr: code that identifies the discount

tablefield.name: a_ar_date_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: date is only required for foreign key; this applies to all of that discount code; therefore the primary key of this table does not include the date

table.name: a_ar_default_discount
table.descr: defines which discounts should be applied by default during a certain event or time period to articles from a certain category
table.label: Default discounts

tablefield.name: a_ar_category_code_c
tablefield.descr: refers to a certain category (catering, hospitality, store, fees)

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_code_c
tablefield.descr: code that identifies the discount

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_date_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: this clearly specifies which version of the discount is meant

tablefield.name: a_ar_date_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: this default discount is only applied during this time period

tablefield.name: a_ar_date_valid_to_d
tablefield.descr: this default discount is only applied during this time period; can be null for ongoing default discounts

table.name: a_ar_invoice
table.descr: the invoice (which is also an offer at a certain stage)
table.label: Invoice

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_key_i
tablefield.descr: Key to uniquely identify invoice
tablefield.label: Invoice Key

tablefield.name: a_status_c
tablefield.descr: an invoice can have these states: OFFER, CHARGED, PARTIALLYPAID, PAID

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: This is the partner who has to pay the bill; can be null for cash payments; could also be another field

tablefield.name: a_date_effective_d
tablefield.descr: this is the date when the invoice was charged

tablefield.name: a_offer_i
tablefield.descr: refers to the offer that was created for this invoice; it is basically an archived copy of the invoice, and the invoice might actually be different from the offer (e.g. hospitality: different number of people, etc.); table ph_booking always refers to the invoice, and the invoice refers to the offer; there is no requirement for an offer to exist, it can be null

tablefield.name: a_taxing_c
tablefield.descr: this defines whether no tax is applied to this invoice (NONE), or if a SPECIAL tax is applied, or if the DEFAULT tax defined for each article; this should work around issues of selling to businesses or customers abroad

tablefield.name: a_special_tax_type_code_c
tablefield.descr: if a_taxing_c has the value SPECIAL, then this tax applies (defined by tax type code, tax rate code, and date valid from
tablefield.label: Tax Type Code
tablefield.help: Enter a tax type code

tablefield.name: a_special_tax_rate_code_c
tablefield.descr: this describes whether it is e.g. the standard, reduced or zero rate of VAT
tablefield.label: Tax Rate Code
tablefield.help: Enter a tax rate code

tablefield.name: a_special_tax_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: this describes when this particular percentage rate has become valid by law
tablefield.label: Tax Rate Code
tablefield.help: Enter a tax rate code

tablefield.name: a_total_amount_n
tablefield.descr: The total amount of money that this invoice is worth; this includes all discounts, even the early payment discount; if the early payment discount does not apply anymore at the time of payment, this total amount needs to be updated
tablefield.label: Total Amount

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: the currency of the total amount

table.name: a_ar_invoice_detail
table.descr: an invoice consists of one or more details
table.label: Invoice Detail

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_invoice_key_i
tablefield.descr: this invoice detail belongs to the invoice with this key
tablefield.label: Invoice Key

tablefield.name: a_detail_number_i
tablefield.descr: A unique number for this detail for its invoice.
tablefield.label: Detail Number

tablefield.name: a_ar_article_code_c
tablefield.descr: code that uniquely identifies the item; can also be a code of a group of equally priced items

tablefield.name: a_ar_reference_c
tablefield.descr: Reference for this invoice detail; for a non specific article that could give more details (e.g. which book of type small book)

tablefield.name: a_ar_number_of_item_i
tablefield.descr: defines the number of the article items that is bought

tablefield.name: a_ar_article_price_d
tablefield.descr: Reference to the price that should be used for this article in this invoice, by date; without discounts, just for single item

tablefield.name: a_calculated_amount_n
tablefield.descr: The total amount of money that this invoice detail is worth; includes the discounts

tablefield.name: a_currency_code_c
tablefield.descr: the currency of the total amount

tablefield.name: a_tax_type_code_c
tablefield.descr: The tax type is always the same, e.g. VAT
tablefield.label: Tax Type Code
tablefield.help: Enter a tax type code

tablefield.name: a_tax_rate_code_c
tablefield.descr: this describes whether it is e.g. the standard, reduced or zero rate of VAT
tablefield.label: Tax Rate Code
tablefield.help: Enter a tax rate code

tablefield.name: a_tax_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: we need to be able to pick a rate that was valid in the past or will be valid in the future

table.name: a_ar_invoice_discount
table.descr: defines which discounts apply directly to the invoice rather than the invoice items; this can depend on the customer etc
table.label: Discount per invoice

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_invoice_key_i
tablefield.descr: Key to uniquely identify invoice
tablefield.label: Invoice Key

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_code_c
tablefield.descr: code that identifies the discount

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_date_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: this clearly specifies which version of the discount is meant

table.name: a_ar_invoice_detail_discount
table.descr: defines which discounts apply one invoice item
table.label: Discount per invoice detail

tablefield.name: a_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: This is used as a key field in most of the accounting system files
tablefield.label: Ledger Number
tablefield.help: Enter the ledger number

tablefield.name: a_invoice_key_i
tablefield.descr: Key to uniquely identify invoice
tablefield.label: Invoice Key

tablefield.name: a_detail_number_i
tablefield.descr: A unique number for this detail for its invoice.
tablefield.label: Detail Number

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_code_c
tablefield.descr: code that identifies the discount

tablefield.name: a_ar_discount_date_valid_from_d
tablefield.descr: this clearly specifies which version of the discount is meant

tablefield.label: Data Type

tablefield.descr: Maximum length of data string if data type is set to character.
tablefield.label: Length

tablefield.descr: Number of decimal places if data type is set to numeric.
tablefield.label: Decimal Places

tablefield.descr: If a lookup category is selected then the values can be chosen from a drop down box
tablefield.label: Lookup Category
tablefield.help: Enter a category to pick values of this data label from a list.

tablefield.name: p_entry_mandatory_l
tablefield.descr: If TRUE then a value for this label has to be set
tablefield.label: Mandatory?
tablefield.help: Is it mandatory to set a value for this data label?

tablefield.name: p_displayed_l
tablefield.descr: If TRUE then this data label will be displayed. Gives a chance to hide but keep labels for historical reasons.
tablefield.label: Displayed?
tablefield.help: Do you want this data label to be displayed?

tablefield.name: p_not_displayed_from_d
tablefield.descr: Data label will not be displayed any longer from this date on.
tablefield.label: End Date for Display
tablefield.help: Date from which on this label will not be displayed any more

tablefield.name: p_editable_l
tablefield.descr: if FALSE then the values will be displayed but are not editable.
tablefield.label: Editable?
tablefield.help: Do you want to be able to edit the values of this data label?

tablefield.name: p_not_editable_from_d
tablefield.descr: Data label values will not be editable any longer from this date on.
tablefield.label: End Date for Editing
tablefield.help: Values of the label cannot be changed anymore after this date.

tablefield.name: p_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: ORGANISATION key of the foundation.
tablefield.label: Foundation Key

tablefield.name: p_owner_1_key_n
tablefield.descr: The Financial Development person who handles appeals to this foundation. Anyone else must get permission from the owner to contact the foundation.
tablefield.label: Owner

tablefield.name: p_owner_2_key_n
tablefield.descr: A second F.D. person who may do business with the foundation.
tablefield.label: Owner 2

tablefield.name: p_key_contact_name_c
tablefield.descr: Name of the contact for this Foundation
tablefield.label: Contact

tablefield.name: p_key_contact_title_c
tablefield.descr: The contact person's title.
tablefield.label: Contact Title

tablefield.name: p_key_contact_email_c
tablefield.descr: Contact email address
tablefield.label: Email

tablefield.name: p_key_contact_phone_c
tablefield.descr: Contact's phone number
tablefield.label: Phone

tablefield.name: p_contact_partner_n
tablefield.descr: Not part of original specification - provided in case contact does ever need to be a full Partner.
tablefield.label: Contact

tablefield.name: p_proposal_submission_type_c
tablefield.descr: A lookup table would go with this. e.g. EMAIL, LETTER.
tablefield.label: Submission Type

tablefield.name: p_review_frequency_c
tablefield.descr: (Monthly | Quarterly | Annually) These are the only ones we use now.
tablefield.label: Review Frequency

tablefield.name: p_submit_frequency_c
tablefield.descr: (Annually | Bi-Annually | No Restrictions) This is a static list.
tablefield.label: Submit Frequency

table.name: p_foundation_proposal_status
table.descr: Foundation proposal status codes and descriptions
table.label: Proposal Status

table.name: p_foundation_proposal
table.descr: Proposals submitted to a Foundation
table.label: Foundation Proposal

tablefield.name: p_submitted_date_d
tablefield.label: Submitted
tablefield.help: The date the proposal was submitted.

tablefield.name: p_partner_submitted_by_n
tablefield.descr: The F.D. person who sent the proposal

table.name: p_foundation_proposal_detail
table.descr: A proposal may be for more than one project or key ministry.
table.label: Foundation Proposal Detail

tablefield.name: p_key_ministry_key_n
tablefield.descr: Used when the proposal is for a key ministry
tablefield.label: Key Ministry

tablefield.name: p_project_ledger_number_i
tablefield.descr: Ledger is part of the primary key for motivations.
tablefield.label: Project Ledger

tablefield.name: p_project_motivation_group_c
tablefield.descr: Used when the proposal is for a project
tablefield.label: Motivation Group

tablefield.name: p_project_motivation_detail_c
tablefield.descr: Used when the proposal is for a project
tablefield.label: Motivation Detail

tablefield.name: p_area_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: The area that the project or key ministry is for
tablefield.label: Area

tablefield.name: p_field_partner_key_n
tablefield.descr: The field that the project or key ministry is for if it applies
tablefield.label: Field

table.label: Proposal Deadline

tablefield.name: p_deadline_month_i
tablefield.descr: The month number
tablefield.label: Month

tablefield.name: p_deadline_day_i
tablefield.descr: The day number
tablefield.label: Day
